## Learning Objectives

* Define a project-oriented workflow in R and identify R startup procedures
* Expand current knowledge of R Markdown
* Basics of Git/GitHub via terminal/command line 

## Readings

Not required before class, use them to clarify the lecture or support your work.

* [Good Enough Practices in Scientific Computing](http://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005510)
* Chapters 1, 2, 3, 7 in [What They Forgot to Teach You About R](https://rstats.wtf/)
* Chapters 27 "R Markdown", 28 "Graphics for communication", and 29 "R Markdown formats" in [R for Data Science 1st Edition](http://r4ds.had.co.nz)
* Article on [Project-oriented workflow](https://www.tidyverse.org/articles/2017/12/workflow-vs-script/)
